content.text:
# Draft:Datta Sakteshwar Tapse

----
Dr.Datta Tapse
Early life and background:
Dr. Datta Sakteshwar Tapse, originally from Sonesangvi village, Kaij Taluka, Beed District.
He completed his primary education at the Zilla Parishad Primary School, Sonesangvi.
He pursued his secondary education at Krantisurya Secondary School, Sonesangvi.
He completed 11th grade at Yogeshwari College, Ambajogai, and 12th grade at Yusuf Wadgaon Secondary and Higher Secondary School.
Career:
Dr.Tapse completed his MBBS at Swami Ramanand Teerth Rural Government Medical College, Ambajogai. During his college years, he began organizing health camps and served as the Secretary of Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Medico Association (DAMA).
In 2014, on the occasion of his birthday, he organized his first health camp at Sonesangvi village. The second camp was held in 2015 at a school for mentally challenged children in Ambajogai. Since then, he has continuously organized diagnostic health camps, blood donation drives, tree plantation initiatives, and provided financial and medical assistance to patients.
After completing his MBBS, with the goal of serving rural and underprivileged communities, he accepted a posting at Morgav in Dodamarg Taluka, Sindhudurg District, where he provided 24-hour medical service. Later, upon deputation, he continued offering round-the-clock healthcare at the Primary Health Center, Nandgaon (Kankavli Taluka).
He conducted health camps in remote, inaccessible regions of Sindhudurg—areas without network coverage or proper roads—and also organized health camps for police personnel. He personally visited critically ill patients at their homes to provide care.
After completing his one-year bond, he returned to his hometown and served at the Rural Hospital, Vashi, providing essential medical services during the COVID-19 pandemic. For his dedicated work, he was honored as a COVID Warrior and Health Ambassador, and received several prestigious recognitions including the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.
He also produced a short film titled “Daan” (Donation), which won international awards in cities like Goa and Mumbai. He co-produced a feature film titled “Aadhaan.”
At Asalde village, Kankavli Taluka, he continuously cared for the elderly at the Divija Old Age Home. After serving four years in Kankavli, he was transferred to the Primary Health Center, Karla, Pune District, where he founded and personally runs “Sanjeevani Old Age Home.”
For the past 12 consecutive years, he has celebrated his birthday through social welfare activities.
He has held several organizational roles, including:
Central Additional General Secretary of the Kaastribe Association
State President of CAGMO Doctors’ Association (which he also founded)
Currently serving as the State Legal Cell President of the Maharashtra State Gazetted Medical Officers’ Association (MAGMO)
President of Rajmudra Medical Foundation
Taluka President (Ambajogai) of the Prahar Organization
